article.title: Raytheon to Install Missile Defense Plug and Fight Kits
article.abstract: Raytheon is being awarded more than $89 million to update and install Plug and Fight A-Kit end items and to support Army Integrated Air and Missile Defense.
article.text: Raytheon Co., Huntsville, Alabama was awarded an $89,525,958 cost-plus-fixed-fee multi-year contract to update and install Plug & Fight (P&F) A-Kit end items and provide Army Integrated Air and Missile Defense (AIAMD) integration, test and evaluation support. One bid was solicited with one received with an estimated completion date of May 1, 2020. Funding and work location will be determined with each order. The Army Contracting Command, Redstone Arsenal, Alabama is the contracting activity (W31P4Q-16-D-0020).

imgalttext.img: Raytheon is being awarded more than $89 million to update and install Plug and Fight A-Kit end items and to support Army Integrated Air and Missile Defense.
